message.content:
cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.OH, cs.MM, cs.CG 

The paper deals with the rendering of surface structure and appearance, which is a common topic in computer graphics (cs.GR). The use of diffraction theory and wave optics suggests a focus on optical effects, which could fall under computer vision (cs.CV) or optics (cs.OH). The paper also mentions the use of line segments to represent surface roughness, which could be related to computational geometry (cs.CG). Finally, the use of real-world examples suggests a possible application in multimedia (cs.MM).
